con:interface.name: LogicalDOC REST API
con:interface.con:description:
This is the interactive documentation of the REST APIs exposed by LogicalDOC. You can find more information about LogicalDOC at http://logicaldoc.com or on Twitter @logicaldoc.
Note: The access path to the API is protected with basic authentication, to be able to run the samples you must log in using the credentials of a Logicaldoc user, or passing to the request the session ID (SID) as a cookie (cookie name: `ldoc-sid`).

Here is an example to list the children folders:
curl -u admin:admin -H ''Accept: application/json'' http://localhost:8080/services/rest/folder/listChildren?folderId=4

More examples are available at the following address: http://wiki.logicaldoc.com/wiki/Bindings_And_Samples

**Find out more about LogicalDOC** http://logicaldoc.com

con:method.name: checkin
con:method.con:description: Performs a check-in (commit) operation of new content over an existing document. The document must be in checked-out status Check-in an existing document

con:parameter.con:name: docId
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of an existing document to update

con:parameter.con:name: release
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates whether to create or not a new major release of the updated document

con:method.name: checkout
con:method.con:description: Performs the checkout operation on a document. The document status will be changed to checked-out Checkout a document

con:method.name: create
con:method.con:description: Creates a new document using the metadata 'document' object provided as JSON/XML Creates a new document

con:parameter.con:name: document
con:parameter.con:description: The document metadata provided as WSDocument object encoded in JSON/XML format

con:method.name: delete
con:method.con:description: Deletes a document

con:method.name: getContent
con:method.con:description: Returns the content of a document using the document ID in input Gets the document content

con:method.name: getDocument
con:method.con:description: Gets the document metadata Gets document metadata

con:method.name: list
con:method.con:description: Lists Documents by folder identifier Lists documents by folder

con:method.name: listDocuments
con:method.con:description: Lists Documents by folder ID filtering the results by filename Lists documents by folder and filename

con:method.name: update
con:method.con:description: Updates the metadata of an existing document. The ID of the document must be specified in the WSDocument value object. The provided example moves document with ID 1111111 to folder 3435433 Updates an existing document

con:method.name: upload
con:method.con:description: Creates or updates an existing document, if used in update mode docId must be provided, when used in create mode folderId is required. Returns the ID of the created/updated document. Example: curl -u admin:admin -H ''Accept: application/json'' -X POST -F folderId=4 -F filename=newDoc.txt -F filedata=@newDoc.txt http://localhost:8080/services/rest/document/upload Uploads a document

con:parameter.con:name: docId
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of an existing document to update

con:parameter.con:name: folderId
con:parameter.con:description: Folder ID where to place the document

con:parameter.con:name: release
con:parameter.con:description: Indicates whether to create or not a new major release of an updated document

con:method.name: create
con:method.con:description: The 'folder' metadata comes in the POST request body (encoded as JSON). Note: folder object must specify at least fields name and parentId Creates a new folder

con:method.name: createFolder
con:method.con:description: Creates a subfolder

con:parameter.con:name: parentId
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the parent folder

con:method.name: createPath
con:method.con:description: Creates a path of folders starting from a parent folder. It returns the metadata object representing the latest created folder in the path Creates a path

con:parameter.con:name: parentId
con:parameter.con:description: The parent folder ID from which the new path will start

con:method.name: createSimple
con:method.con:description: Creates folders using an input path. All the folders in the path will be created. It returns the metadata object representing the latest created folder in the path. Example: curl -u admin:admin -X POST -H ''Content-Type: text/plain'' -H ''Accept: application/json'' -d ''/Default/Curl/newfolder'' http://localhost:8080/services/rest/folder/createSimple Creates folders from path

con:method.name: createSimpleForm
con:method.con:description: Creates folders using an input path. All the folders in the path will be created. It returns the metadata object representing the latest created folder in the path Creates folders from path

con:parameter.con:name: folderPath
con:parameter.con:description: The string representing the path to be created

con:method.name: createSimpleJSON
con:method.con:description: Creates folders using an input path. All the folders in the path will be created. It returns the metadata object representing the latest created folder in the path Creates folders from path

con:method.name: delete
con:method.con:description: Deletes a folder

con:parameter.con:name: folderId
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the folder to be deleted

con:method.name: getFolder
con:method.con:description: Gets the folder with the specified ID Gets a folder

con:method.name: getPath
con:method.con:description: Returns the folders that make up the path to the folder in input. Gets a path of folders

con:method.name: getPathString
con:method.con:description: Returns the path to the folder in input. Gets a path

con:method.name: listChildren
con:method.con:description: Returns the list of child folders. Example: curl -u admin:admin -H ''Accept: application/json'' http://localhost:8080/services/rest/folder/listChildren?folderId=4 Lists the child folders

con:parameter.con:name: folderId
con:parameter.con:description: The ID of the parent folder

con:method.name: move
con:method.con:description: Updates a folder by changing its parent. The folder is moved to the new parent folder. Moves a folder

con:method.name: rename
con:method.con:description: Changes the name of a given folder Renames a folder

con:method.name: update
con:method.con:description: Updates a folder changing its metadata. The folder object in input must specify the property id Updates a folder

con:method.name: find
con:method.con:description: Runs a search on the server Search documents
